channel.title: CW Suggestion MK 2
channel.description:
> # [color = "steblue"] Court Wizard [/color] > **[color = "steblue"] Blue Dragon Support [/color]** > > Day Ability 1: Magic Barrier - Target player will be conversion immune. The barrier stays on the target until you choose a new one, die or get converted. (Unlimited) > > Day Ability 2: Weaken - Anyone that tries to visit target player will be empowered tonight. Your target will not be occupy or night immune tonight. (3 uses) > > Night Ability 1: Empower - Target player will be occupy immune and cannot be tampered with. Their ability's will bypass all immunity's. An Empowered player cannot use Empower to bypass an Immunity gained through Empower. The player will still appear to not be Occupy immune if they weren't already. (Unlimited) > > Night Ability 2: Tornado - Anyone targeting one of your targets will be redirected to the other. (3 uses)
Note: Expose doesn't effect ability's that don't count as visits. They are not trying to visit.
> # [color = "purple"] Sage [/color] > **[color = "purple"] Unseen Support [/color]** > > Day Ability: Weaken - Anyone that tries to visit target player will be empowered tonight. Your target will not be occupy or night immune tonight. (3 uses) > > Night Ability 1: Tornado - Same > Night Ability 2: Wall of Fire - Same
> # [color = "darkred"] Ritualist [/color] > **[color = "darkred"] Cult Support [/color]** > > Passive: Will of Mithras - Same > > Day Ability: Brotherhood - The cult's Ability's will bypass immunitys tonight. (1 use) > > Night Ability 1: Teleport - same (3 uses) > Night Ability 2: Shroud - Prevent visits to Target cult member. (2 uses)

item.title: CW Suggestion MK 2
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Also 2 uses of both telepathy and of PP.

The real pattern is 3 uses of a primary ability and 2 uses of a secondary power.

item.title: CW Suggestion MK 2
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
First of all for Butler. It has the additional advantage of bypassing OCC Immunity given through 3 Occupys. Giving Occupy Immunity to someone is good in of itself.

The extra versitility from immunity bypass and decoupling it from conversion blocking is what makes it more fun.

Read full topic

item.title: CW Suggestion MK 2
item.dc:creator: RawkHawk
item.description:
Okay, so let’s just assume you want to empower butler. What are you accomplishing? The only occ immune classes to be really concerned with are possessor, sorc, and mastermind. And occupying any of these delays their action, which is nice. You could also occupy a Hunter using bear. Or prince about to execute. You’re giving the butler a free happy hour. Everyone else you’re just making occ immune which current barrier already does.

So I have to ask again: how is this “more fun” than magic barrier? It forces you to combo with bd offensive and investigative roles, and if they don’t claim to you, there is no combo it be had. Along with that, the Court wizard gets no feedback and relies on his target making correct decisions for his ability to be effective. None of this adds up to a fun ability.

Read full topic

item.title: CW Suggestion MK 2
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
For the record. Empower does not block bypasses from Ability’s besides itself. So while a second CW can’t have an empowered Butler Occupys an Empowered sheriff. A Drunk CAN Occupy an empowered sheriff like normal with HH.

Read full topic
